intro: Astragalus kemulariae, commonly known as the Kashmir milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus kemulariae is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
